smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the file contain content; no empty diagrams were found.
All Use Cases are associated with an actor, either directly or indirectly via «include» relationships (e.g., 'Vaata kõiki ootel...' is included by use cases connected to 'Autode haldur').
No actors are associated with multiple use cases that have synonymous names. Distinct actions (e.g., 'Muuda autot' vs 'Muuda auto mittaktiivseks') represent different functionalities.
On Page 1, in the package 'Klassifikaatorite register' (inside 'Registrid'), the element 'Auto_mark' is listed twice (once near the top and once at the bottom of the list).
No redundant data duplication (denormalization) without foreign keys was found in the database diagrams. Common columns like 'nimetus' refer to the entity's own name, not a copied value.
Use case naming is consistent. All use cases use the imperative verb form (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri').
In the State Diagram (Page 9), all states (Ootel, Aktiivne, Mitteaktiivne, etc.) are reachable via defined transitions.
In the Activity Diagram (Page 4), all actions are reachable through the decision flows.
Relationships in class and database diagrams have multiplicities defined (e.g., 1, 0..*, 0..1) where applicable.
No single diagram contains 10 or more central elements. The most populated diagram (Page 15) contains 9 tables.
No single class or table has 6 or more visual connection lines on a single page. The maximum observed is 5 connections for the 'Isik' class on Page 6.
The layout of elements is reasonably compact across all diagrams.

In the Activity Diagram 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4), the actions 'Otsimine' (Searching) and 'Valimine' (Choosing/Selection) are named using nouns/gerunds instead of active verbs (e.g., 'Otsi', 'Vali').
All class, table, attribute, and use case names exceed 3 characters (e.g., 'Riik', 'Isik', 'Auto' are 4 characters).
Class names start with uppercase letters and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
Attribute and column names start with lowercase letters (e.g., 'eesnimi', 'nimetus').
Element names do not use type prefixes like 'tbl_' or 'str'. Allowed prefixes like 'PK_', 'FK_' are present in database diagrams.
